title: RADS ERROR FIX
body:
1. Right click on your connection icon in the bottom right of your screen.
2. Go to the network centre. 
3. Go to the adapter settings.
4. Search your connection.
5. Right click -> properties.
6. Search Internet protocol version 4.
7. Right click -> properties.
8. Change your DNS servers to 8.8.4.4 (the first one) and 8.8.8.8 (the second one).ï»¿

Hopefully it works :) as it worked for me

replies.body:
That's great, a nice concise instruction set on how to change your DNS.

I'd appreciate it if you told people that you're switching them over from their ISP's DNS over to Google's Public DNS. Could cause some issues with warranty and whatnot.
Holy! it actually did work for some reason! good find!! should be stickied
You my friend are a walking legend! Insta-Fix thank you!

Strange... I changed my DNS to 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 and it worked... for a few days

It stopped working yesterday.

Then I read your post and reversed it to 8.8.4.4 and 8.8.8.8 and it worked again.
